oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Joe Ely - 2018-05-26
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by singer songwriter Joe Ely from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on May 26, 2018. Presented in support of the exhibit Outlaws & Armadillos: Country’s Roaring ʼ70s.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Joe Ely;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in Music / (04:00) Opening comments and introduction by Michael Gray / (09:21) Performs Satisfied At Last / (12:19) Performs Treat Me Like A Saturday Night / (15:22) Opening comments by Joe with talk about his time in Austin, the Flatlanders and tells story about meeting Townes Van Zandt / (19:51) Tells story about ending up working with a circus / (21:19) Introduces the next song / (21:36) Performs Indian Cowboy / (23:53) Performs The Highway Is My Home / (28:40) Performs Carnival Bum / (32:28) Talks about the carnival theme in his life / (33:33) Introduces the next song / (33:50) Performs Tonight I Think I'm Gonna Go Downtown / (37:07) Talks about his group with Jesse "Guitar Hercules" Taylor and Lloyd Maines and playing the Cotton Club in Lubbock, Texas / (41:06) Introduces the next song / (41:22) Performs Honky Tonk Masquerade / (45:26) Talks about Billy Joe Shaver, Bobby Bare, Waylon Jennings and playing behind bullet-proof glass in hockey arenas / (47:45) Talks about Guy Clark / (48:04) Performs Magdalene / (51:00) Performs All Just To Get To You / (54:46) Closing comments by Joe / (55:09) Walk-out Music / (55:42) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:format: original source recorded as an mp3 file at 44.1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Ely, Joe; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
